meanings.definition: To enclose or fortify with walls
meanings.sent1: The king decided to mure the castle for protection.
meanings.sent2: Builders often mure houses with strong bricks.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to mure their play area with imaginary walls.
meanings.sent4: Her love for books seemed to mure her in a world of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization would mure their cities to keep enemies out.

meanings.sent1: The garden had a beautiful mure covered in ivy.
meanings.sent2: The mure around the old town was made of stone.
meanings.sent3: The cat loved to climb the mure to watch the birds.
meanings.sent4: The mure between the two properties symbolized their separation.
meanings.sent5: The mure of the fortress stood tall against the horizon.

meanings.sent1: The detective had to mure the suspect until the trial.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the evil witch would mure people in her tower.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to mure itself in the shed.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of loneliness seemed to mure her heart.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds seemed to mure the entire town in gloom.
